subject: Sleep
title: Snoring Means Deep Sleep
description: A quick, practical guide to Snoring Means Deep Sleep.

hook.text: People assume loud snoring means someone is deeply asleep. In many cases, it means the opposite.

buildup.text: Snoring occurs when the airway partially collapses, creating turbulent airflow that vibrates soft tissue.

discovery.text: Heavy snoring often fragments sleep, causing frequent micro-arousals that the sleeper never consciously notices.

twist.text: Snorers frequently feel unrefreshed despite long sleep because their actual sleep quality is severely compromised.

climax.text: The louder the snoring, the more likely sleep architecture is disrupted. Volume correlates with severity, not depth.

punchline.text: Loud snoring doesn't mean deep sleep. It often means terrible sleep.

quiz.question: Does loud snoring indicate deep sleep?
options: Yes, louder snoring means deeper sleep
No, loud snoring often fragments sleep and correlates with poor sleep quality
Snoring has no relationship to sleep quality
